review_blob: Bottle. Feint malt aroma. Pale yellow with a decent head. A nice example of the stlye... refreshing, crisp, and thirst-quenching. Not a "wow" beer by any means, but perfectly drinkable ans satisfying.

Bottle. The aroma was malty choclate sniffed from about 50 paces... in other words, feint. I was quite disappointed by this beer... in fact, Ive had brown ales with more body and character... unbalanced bitterness was the overriding taste... Ill try it again on the hope it was a mistreated bottle.

Bottle. Pours an almost lemon yellow, with a somewhat wispy head. Aroma is a feint lemony hops. It has a crisp clean hoppy-fruit taste... very refreshing... a quitessential summer beer. Suprised by the low rating. This is a very nice beer... Kolsch-style beers are not made to knock your socks off.
beer_name: Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with a beige foamy head. Aroma is a mild malt with hints of roasted grain and chocolate. Although Schwarzbiers are supposed to be quite bitter, this beer is only moderately so. However, its has a nice malty, feint chocolatey  taste that is quite pleasant to go along with its background bitterness. All and all, a nice beer.

Bottle. Pale copper with thick but quickly dissipating head. Malty aroma with hint of hops and bread. A very nicely balanced beer, though more malty than hoppy. Deceptive depth. A better beer than you might expect, though not in a class with the top lagers. Still, a perfectly acceptable bottle of beer.

Bottle. Golden color. Light aroma. Faint hop flavor. This is a light-weight fairly charcterless brew. Fine to drink after a lawn-mowing excursion, or to quench a summer thirst, but overall not a very interesting beer.

Bottle. Golden yellow with relatively thin head. Light citrus/hop aroma. Crisp, clean, balanced flavor with somewhat subtle citurs/hop taste perfect for summer drinking. Refrshing on the palate. Not built to be a BIG beer... it is what it is, and its a fine summer pilsener.
